verses.text: \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* \add was\add* \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w* when he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, and he \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*:

But \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which was\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, like unto the \w abominations|strong="H8441"\w* of the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w*, whom the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had cast \w out|strong="H3423"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

¶ For he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w again|strong="H7725"\w* the high \w places|strong="H1116"\w* which \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* had broken \w down|strong="H5422"\w*, and he reared \w up|strong="H6965"\w* \w altars|strong="H4196"\w* for \w Baalim|strong="H1168"\w*, and \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w groves|strong="H0842"\w*, and \w worshipped|strong="H7812"\w* all the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*, and \w served|strong="H5647"\w* them.\f + \fr 33.3 \ft he built…: Heb. he returned and built\f*

Also he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w altars|strong="H4196"\w* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, whereof the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, In \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* shall my \w name|strong="H8034"\w* be for \w ever|strong="H5769"\w*.

And he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w altars|strong="H4196"\w* for all the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w* in the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w courts|strong="H2691"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And he \w caused|strong="H5674"\w* his \w children|strong="H1121"\w* to pass \w through|strong="H5674"\w* the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* in the \w valley|strong="H1516"\w* of the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hinnom|strong="H2011"\w*: also he observed \w times|strong="H6049"\w*, and used \w enchantments|strong="H5172"\w*, and used \w witchcraft|strong="H3784"\w*, and \w dealt|strong="H6213"\w* with a familiar \w spirit|strong="H0178"\w*, and with \w wizards|strong="H3049"\w*: he \w wrought|strong="H6213"\w* \w much|strong="H7235"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to provoke him to \w anger|strong="H3707"\w*.

And he \w set|strong="H7760"\w* a carved \w image|strong="H6459"\w*, the \w idol|strong="H5566"\w* which he had \w made|strong="H6213"\w*, in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, of which \w God|strong="H0430"\w* had \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w* and to \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, In this \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, which I have \w chosen|strong="H0977"\w* before all the \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, will I \w put|strong="H7760"\w* my \w name|strong="H8034"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5865"\w*:

Neither will I any \w more|strong="H3254"\w* \w remove|strong="H5493"\w* the \w foot|strong="H7272"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* from \w out|strong="H5921"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0127"\w* which I have \w appointed|strong="H5975"\w* for your \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*; so \w that|strong="H0518"\w* they will take \w heed|strong="H8104"\w* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* all that I have \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* them, according to the whole \w law|strong="H8451"\w* and the \w statutes|strong="H2706"\w* and the \w ordinances|strong="H4941"\w* by the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Moses|strong="H4872"\w*.

So \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* \w made|strong="H8582"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* to \w err|strong="H8582"\w*, \add and\add* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w worse|strong="H7451"\w* than the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w*, whom the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had \w destroyed|strong="H8045"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* to \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w*, and to his \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: but they would not \w hearken|strong="H7181"\w*.

¶ Wherefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* upon them the captains \w of|strong="H8269"\w* the host \w of|strong="H6635"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*, which \w took|strong="H3920"\w* \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* among the \w thorns|strong="H2336"\w*, and bound \w him|strong="H0631"\w* with \w fetters|strong="H5178"\w*, and \w carried|strong="H3212"\w* him to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.\f + \fr 33.11 \ft of the king: Heb. which were the king’s\f*\f + \fr 33.11 \ft fetters: or, chains\f*

And when he was in \w affliction|strong="H6887"\w*, he \w besought|strong="H2470"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and \w humbled|strong="H3665"\w* himself \w greatly|strong="H3966"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of his \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*,

And \w prayed|strong="H6419"\w* unto him: and he was \w intreated|strong="H6279"\w* of him, and \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* his \w supplication|strong="H8467"\w*, and brought him \w again|strong="H7725"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* into his \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*. Then \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* he \add was\add* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

Now after \w this|strong="H0310"\w* he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* a \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* \w without|strong="H2435"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, on the west \w side|strong="H4628"\w* of \w Gihon|strong="H1521"\w*, in the \w valley|strong="H5158"\w*, even to the entering \w in|strong="H0935"\w* at the \w fish|strong="H1709"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*, and \w compassed|strong="H5437"\w* about \w Ophel|strong="H6077"\w*, and raised it \w up|strong="H1361"\w* a very great \w height|strong="H3966"\w*, and \w put|strong="H7760"\w* \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of \w war|strong="H2428"\w* in all the \w fenced|strong="H1219"\w* \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*.\f + \fr 33.14 \ft Ophel: or, the tower\f*

And he took \w away|strong="H5493"\w* the \w strange|strong="H5236"\w* \w gods|strong="H0430"\w*, and the \w idol|strong="H5566"\w* out of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and all the \w altars|strong="H4196"\w* that he had \w built|strong="H1129"\w* in the \w mount|strong="H2022"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w cast|strong="H7993"\w* \add them\add* \w out|strong="H2351"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

And he \w repaired|strong="H1129"\w* the \w altar|strong="H4196"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and \w sacrificed|strong="H2076"\w* thereon \w peace|strong="H8002"\w* \w offerings|strong="H2077"\w* and thank \w offerings|strong="H8426"\w*, and \w commanded|strong="H0559"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* to \w serve|strong="H5647"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

\w Nevertheless|strong="H0061"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* did \w sacrifice|strong="H2076"\w* still in the high \w places|strong="H1116"\w*, \add yet\add* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their \w God|strong="H0430"\w* only.

¶ Now the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w acts|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w*, and his \w prayer|strong="H8605"\w* unto his \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w seers|strong="H2374"\w* that \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* to him in the \w name|strong="H8034"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, behold, they \add are written\add* in the \w book|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

His \w prayer|strong="H8605"\w* also, and \add how God\add* was \w intreated|strong="H6279"\w* of him, and all his \w sin|strong="H2403"\w*, and his \w trespass|strong="H4604"\w*, and the \w places|strong="H4725"\w* wherein he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* high \w places|strong="H1116"\w*, and set \w up|strong="H5975"\w* \w groves|strong="H0842"\w* and graven \w images|strong="H6456"\w*, \w before|strong="H6440"\w* he was \w humbled|strong="H3665"\w*: behold, they \add are\add* \w written|strong="H3789"\w* among the \w sayings|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w seers|strong="H2374"\w*.\f + \fr 33.19 \ft the seers: or, Hosai\f*

¶ So \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* \w slept|strong="H7901"\w* with his \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*, and they \w buried|strong="H6912"\w* him in his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and \w Amon|strong="H0526"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.

¶ \w Amon|strong="H0526"\w* \add was\add* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w* when he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, and \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

But he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which was\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, as \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* his \w father|strong="H0001"\w*: for \w Amon|strong="H0526"\w* \w sacrificed|strong="H2076"\w* unto all the carved \w images|strong="H6456"\w* which \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* had \w made|strong="H6213"\w*, and \w served|strong="H5647"\w* them;

And \w humbled|strong="H3665"\w* not himself \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, as \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* had \w humbled|strong="H3665"\w* himself; but \w Amon|strong="H0526"\w* \w trespassed|strong="H0819"\w* more and \w more|strong="H7235"\w*.\f + \fr 33.23 \ft trespassed more and more: Heb. multiplied trespass\f*
And his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w conspired|strong="H7194"\w* against him, and \w slew|strong="H4191"\w* him in his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

¶ But the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \w slew|strong="H5221"\w* all them that had \w conspired|strong="H7194"\w* against \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Amon|strong="H0526"\w*; and the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \w made|strong="H4427"\w* \w Josiah|strong="H2977"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w king|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.
